channel.title: RuneVote v1.0 (Vote4cash Setup!)
channel.description:
[s]Simple but effective ;) [/s] [i]Hello thanks for reading, i wanted to help out the community by making a Vote script that well install a Vote4cash script.... And since people couldn't connect it website sidded i decided to add a simple install feature :3 Its very Simple if you can install a Smf Forum then u can easily install this :)[/i] Update Log:
Instructions installation Feature Server Description Option Server name Feature Main Site option
Media: [img]http://img607.imageshack.us/img607/1993/86a6a3be25b445fb8f2445f.png[/img] [img]http://img208.imageshack.us/img208/4743/850a46bb9d10452b8667bbf.png[/img] [img]http://img641.imageshack.us/img641/1233/acfb1e76f1a24de1ac74846.png[/img] [i]The php scripts and idea belongs to RuneVote, so please do not try to remake it without permission. [/i] [u]Installation Guide [/u]
By using this Script and or Scripts you are agreeing to the following: 1) You are not Apart of Jagex ltd 2) You were not asked by Jagex ltd to view RuneVote v1.0 php scripts. 3) You are not a member of Jagex ltd, FunOrb, and or Runescape.com 4) You may not Steal any php scripts and claim as your own 5) You may not sell unless you have permssion 6) You agree that the php scritps were made in the art of programming. ---------------------------------------------- Instructions: First: Sign up a webhost. (Recommend webhosting company's) (Free!) http://1freehosting.com/ ( Recommended) http://000webhost.com/ (Medium) http://x10hosting.com/ (low) http://byethosting.com/ (low) Second: Once Signed up you must then, Create a DataBase and or database username. Third: Make sure to copy the information giving onto a notepad and or any form of keeping track of the information Four: Paste the information to http://yoursite.com/install.php/ five: Vote4cash is now Installed Website Sidded. Five: Visit and test http://yoursite.com/vote.php ---------------------------------------------------------
What you can expect in v2 [ol][li]Connection Test[/li] [li]Template selection[/li] [li]Total Clicks[/li] [li]Hours per vote[/li] [li]Username Voted[/li][/ol] if you have any suggestions please feel free to suggest. Download: https://dl.dropbox.com/u/81583746/RuneVote%20v1.0%20Realsed.zip

item.title: RuneVote v1.0 (Vote4cash Setup!)
item.dc:creator: @The_Web_Guy The Web Guy
item.description:
@The_Web_Guy wrote:

runestate:

Ruby Your the worst Php coder of all time the only reason u got that rank is by leeching ive seen your template and there all leeched dont even start talking about php cause i well smash you.

This made me giggle.
Ruby earned his ranking for a reason, from the looks of it, he’s a better PHP programmer than you. This is a simple script that I could have done in a few minutes, literally. As for the other discussion about how it takes a certain amount of time to grasp a language. PHP takes years and years to master, and as Ruby stated, you learn along the way. I can easily say that I’m still learning, sure, I’ve done it for years now, and I do it professionally, however, I’m still figuring out better methods of doing something when programming. I could probably understand grasping HTML in a couple days, however, you’re still not going to learn all of the tags and correct usages or scenarios for them. It’s impossible to grasp PHP in two days.

And also, considering the fact that I was teaching you PHP, and it took a couple days to workout the main script of a log-in system with you.

Read full topic

item.title: RuneVote v1.0 (Vote4cash Setup!)
item.dc:creator: @justaguy justaguy
item.description:
@justaguy wrote:

[quote=“Arcik, post:12, topic:462665”][quote]Website development is in now way easy. For example; PHP may be easier to grasp than other languages. However, it still takes some serious work and dedication. I’d even go to the point of years of learning to become considered as a good programmer.
[/quote]

I’d say It’ll take 1-2 days to learn get the gist of it and “years”? Could take under a month to actually seriously pro. Yeah it’ll take some dedication and daily practise but it is really simple stuff. I’m saying this over experience since I was taught in the most ‘loling’ way.[/quote]

Show us some work you’ve done then we can establish what sort of level you are at. Just because you know a language doesn’t make you a pro in that field. I can know Java but not be an expert at it.

Read full topic

item.title: RuneVote v1.0 (Vote4cash Setup!)
item.dc:creator: @Ashi Ashi
item.description:
@Ashi wrote:

[quote=“Ruby, post:15, topic:462665”][quote author=Arcik link=topic=565856.msg4117175#msg4117175 date=1349182864]

[quote]Website development is in now way easy. For example; PHP may be easier to grasp than other languages. However, it still takes some serious work and dedication. I’d even go to the point of years of learning to become considered as a good programmer.

Find a language you don’t know.
Spend around 1-2hrs per day learning it, experimenting etc.
Few weeks/months times, notice the difference?

Could take under a month to actually seriously pro.

If you believe this then you have serious issues or you’re a complete and utter revolutionary programming genius.
[/quote]

Call me smart? Quick learner? or it’s just probs the simplest computing language? I’ll make an idiots guide soon.
[/quote]

Just because you understand a language doesn’t mean you’re good at it. While programming you should always be learning. It takes years to even be considered good in a language, not weeks lol.[/quote]

Read full topic

item.title: RuneVote v1.0 (Vote4cash Setup!)
item.dc:creator: @Ruby_Forums_Coder Ruby
item.description:
@Ruby_Forums_Coder wrote:

runestate:

Ruby Your the worst Php coder of all time the only reason u got that rank is by leeching ive seen your template and there all leeched dont even start talking about php cause i well smash you.

I primarily use Bootstrap and integrate forums to it, if you’re talking about the bare templates yes, they are the bootstrap default. If I was such a bad programmer I would never have been given the badge. I leeched one template a while back and I’ve managed to redeem myself. Don’t you think that Taharok and the staff check up before they go giving badges? In the end if they give someone a badge and its wrongly given it falls back on them. I was assigned a specific task and I completed that task to the standard required.

I only asked you if you integrated callback systems so that people could actually be ensured of votes being counted. I never questioned your knowledge of the worlds most hideous language.

item.title: RuneVote v1.0 (Vote4cash Setup!)
item.dc:creator: @runestate runestate
item.description:
@runestate wrote:

Simple but effective

Hello thanks for reading, i wanted to help out the community by making a Vote script that well install a Vote4cash script…
And since people couldn’t connect it website sidded i decided to add a simple install feature :3
Its very Simple if you can install a Smf Forum then u can easily install this

Update Log:

Instructions installation Feature Server Description Option Server name Feature Main Site option

Media:

The php scripts and idea belongs to RuneVote, so please do not try to remake it without permission.

Installation Guide

By using this Script and or Scripts you are agreeing to the following:

You are not Apart of Jagex ltd
2)
You were not asked by Jagex ltd to view RuneVote v1.0 php scripts.
3)
You are not a member of Jagex ltd, FunOrb, and or Runescape.com
4)
You may not Steal any php scripts and claim as your own
5)
You may not sell unless you have permssion
6)
You agree that the php scritps were made in the art of programming.

Instructions:

First: Sign up a webhost.
(Recommend webhosting company’s) (Free!)
http://1freehosting.com/ ( Recommended)
http://000webhost.com/ (Medium)
http://x10hosting.com/ (low)
http://byethosting.com/ (low)

Second:
Once Signed up you must then, Create a DataBase and or database username.

Third:
Make sure to copy the information giving onto a notepad and or any form of keeping track of the information

Four:
Paste the information to http://yoursite.com/install.php/

five:
Vote4cash is now Installed Website Sidded.

Five:
Visit and test http://yoursite.com/vote.php

---------------------------------------------------------

What you can expect in v2

[ol][li]Connection Test[/li]
[li]Template selection[/li]
[li]Total Clicks[/li]
[li]Hours per vote[/li]
[li]Username Voted[/li][/ol]

if you have any suggestions please feel free to suggest.

Download:
https://dl.dropbox.com/u/81583746/RuneVote%20v1.0%20Realsed.zip

Read full topic
